senses.de: A machine or device used to display, check, and keep track of something
senses.ex: She checks her blood pressure daily using a monitor.

Tips.title: Not Just Computers
Tips.description: Monitor can refer to various tracking devices, not limited to computer screens.
Tips.example: The nurse attached a heart rate monitor to the patient.

Tips.title: Usage Consistency
Tips.description: 'Monitor' as a device is consistently used across different fields like medicine and technology.
Tips.example: Install a carbon monoxide monitor in your house for safety.

senses.de: To watch and check a situation carefully for a period of time in order to discover something about it
senses.ex: The teacher monitors the students progress throughout the school year.

Tips.title: Continual Action
Tips.description: As a verb, 'monitor' implies ongoing observation, not just a one-time check.
Tips.example: We need to monitor the weather conditions before the hike.

senses.de: A person who has the job of watching or noticing particular things
senses.ex: She was appointed as the monitor for the class.

Tips.title: Responsibility
Tips.description: A monitor as a person is often responsible for reporting any issues observed.
Tips.example: He is the safety monitor for our workshop.

senses.de: The part of a computer that contains the screen where images and data are displayed

Tips.title: Computing Specific
Tips.description: When used in computing, 'monitor' specifically refers to the part showing the display output.

senses.de: A large reptile similar to a lizard
senses.ex: The Komodo Dragon is a species of monitor lizard.

Tips.title: Biology Context
Tips.description: In biology, ‘monitor’ refers to a creature, not an electronic device.
Tips.example: We observed the monitor basking in the sun.

senses.ex: Monitors were used during the Civil War.

Tips.title: Historic Use
Tips.description: The military use of 'monitor' is historical and may not be common in current contexts.
Tips.example: The old naval monitor was preserved as a museum piece.

Checker.wordDefinition:
A checker is someone who verifies or inspects for accuracy or completeness. This is often used in situations where something needs to be confirmed or verified, such as a test or an assignment.

A checker is for verifying accuracy or completeness, while a monitor is for watching over a situation or activity.

Controller.wordDefinition:
A controller is a device or person that manages or directs a system to achieve a particular goal or outcome. For example, a game controller directs the actions of a character in a game, while a traffic controller directs the movements of vehicles on a road.

A controller is used to actively manage and direct a system, while a monitor is used to passively observe and detect changes in a system.

Inspector.wordDefinition:
Inspector refers to someone who formally examines or assesses something or someone with the purpose of ensuring that certain standards or rules are being met.

In general, inspectors are associated with more formal and structured inspections while monitors tend to involve more ongoing and informal observation.

Observer.wordDefinition:
The words monitor and observer are similar in that they both involve watching or keeping track of something.

However, monitor often implies an active process of checking or measuring something regularly, while observer more commonly refers to someone who watches or witnesses something without necessarily taking action.

Observer is usually used in contexts where the focus is on watching or witnessing something, such as in sports, nature watching, or social interactions.

Recorder.wordDefinition:
A recorder is a device used for capturing and storing information or data.

It is used to keep a record of an event or process. For example, a voice recorder is used to capture and store audio information.

Both monitors and recorders are applicable in various fields, including healthcare, security, and technology.

A monitor is useful for keeping an eye on a situation, while a recorder is good for keeping a record of events.

Supervisor.wordDefinition:
A supervisor is someone who oversees a group of people or a process to make sure that everything is going according to plan.

They have the authority to make decisions and give instructions to the people they are supervising. For example, a supervisor at a factory would oversee the workers and make sure they are following the correct procedures to make the products.

The difference between a monitor and a supervisor is that a monitor watches to make sure things are happening correctly, while a supervisor is in charge and directs others to make sure things are happening correctly.

Surveyor.wordDefinition:
Surveyor refers to a person who inspects or examines land, buildings or other structures to determine their boundaries or quality.

Surveyors use various tools to measure and map out the land. They are commonly used in construction, or to determine property boundaries when buying land, etc.

A monitor checks things regularly and keeps an eye on them, while a surveyor is a professional who examines and maps out land or buildings.

Tracker.wordDefinition:
The word Tracker generally means actively following something, such as a movement or location. It is commonly used in the context of tracking devices that show the location of a person or object.

A tracker is designed to actively take action based on the information it receives. For example, a GPS tracker can give directions to a lost person.

A monitor observes and keeps track of something, while a tracker tracks and takes action based on what it observes.

Watch.wordDefinition:
Both monitor and watch involve keeping an eye on something, but the difference between the two is the level of attention and the purpose.

To watch something means to observe it for a specific reason or objective, such as for safety or entertainment. For example, a lifeguard may watch a swimming pool to ensure nobody is in danger, while a person may watch a movie for enjoyment.

In summary, monitoring is a sustained and careful observation in order to track progress, while watching is a focused observation for a specific purpose.

quotes.Text: I just want to raise a confident girl. I just want her to know that she doesn't need to be sending naked pictures and doing all that stuff - I'm definitely going to monitor everything. I want to raise her to know that she can go do whatever she wants in life and to be comfortable in her own skin, which I think also just comes with age and time.
quotes.Title: American Actress
quotes.Name: Kristin Cavallari

quotes.Text: I don't ever have any bass in my monitors at all; I instead like to lock in with the guitar. I know the bass player has got to be locked in with the drummer, but to me, metal music is about the guitar and drums locking in and operating like a machine together. I played with my brother forever, and we were magically locked in together.
quotes.Title: American Musician
quotes.Name: Vinnie Paul

quotes.Text: Throughout the western world, new systems have risen up whose job is to constantly record and monitor the present - and then compare that to the recorded past. The aim is to discover patterns, coincidences and correlations, and from that, find ways of stopping change. Keeping things the same.
quotes.Title: British Director
quotes.Name: Adam Curtis

quotes.Text: The ability of businesses to monitor our behavior is already a fact of life, and it isn't going away. Of course we must protect our privacy rights. But if we're smart, we'll also use the data that is being collected to improve our own lives.
quotes.Title: American Economist
quotes.Name: Richard Thaler

quotes.Text: Tests account for only a couple of hours within the six years of a child's primary education, but parents expect to know how their children are doing and the government has a responsibility to monitor and control standards.
quotes.Title: British Politician
quotes.Name: Andrew Adonis, Baron Adonis

quotes.Text: Filmmaking these days is so technically advanced. When I started off, we had to wait for two to three months to see the rushes. But now you can see every scene on the monitor and you can see your work immediately.
quotes.Title: Indian Actress
quotes.Name: Amala Akkineni

quotes.Text: We're rapidly entering a world where everything can be monitored and measured. But the big problem is going to be the ability of humans to use, analyze and make sense of the data.
quotes.Title: American Educator
quotes.Name: Erik Brynjolfsson

quotes.Text: The constant monitoring of our emotional landscape and personal interactions is a bizarre concept. But it is one that could help many people.
quotes.Title: American Businessman
quotes.Name: Peter Diamandis

quotes.Text: I'm still passionately interested in what my fellow humans are up to. For me, a day spent monitoring the passing parade is a day well-spent.
quotes.Title: American Cartoonist
quotes.Name: Garry Trudeau

quotes.Text: You may not believe in anything called a work-life balance, but your body certainly does. You need to monitor and nurture your body.
quotes.Title: Indian Businessman
quotes.Name: Vivek Wadhwa
